intro: Chamaesyce mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' sandmat, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant has hairy, branched stems and produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, often covered with fine hairs. Native to arid regions of the southwestern United States, it is well adapted to sandy and rocky soils.
